lead_paragraph: HICKMAN--Irene. Irene Hickman (nee Davis), 82, of Summit, NJ, passed away March 15, 2016. Born in Brooklyn, attended Rose Haven School for Girls in Rockleigh, NJ and St. Francis Xavier Academy Brooklyn. While working on Wall Street, Irene met her husband of 58 years, J. Kenneth Hickman. Shortly thereafter, they moved to Leonia, NJ, then settled in Summit in 1969. A gracious host and entertainer, Irene's home was always open to her far-reaching circle of friends. Good food, a well-stocked bar and camaraderie welcomed guests. Irene loved to travel. She enjoyed tennis, bridge, and bowling. Irene and Ken focused their support on education and the arts. Longtime members of the Metropolitan Opera, they attended regularly and enjoyed time in Manhattan. Irene was a member of the Beacon Hill Club, Fortnightly Club and Summit Twig. Clever, loyal, and strong, Irene was an independent woman with high standards and a dry sense of humor - traits she proudly passed on to her three girls. Predeceased by her husband, Ken; Irene is survived by many cherished friends, her daughters Trish, Carolyn and Beth, four granddaughters and a great-grandson. Relatives and friends are invited to visit with the family at Beacon Hill Club, 250 Hobart Ave., Summit, NJ on Tuesday, March 22, 3-7pm. Services will be held Wednesday, March 23, 1:30pm at St. Teresa of Avila Church, 306 Morris Ave., Summit, NJ. In lieu of flowers, the family requests memorial donations be made to the Community Foundation of New Jersey - Irene and Ken Hickman Family Fund at www.cfnj.org. 1/3
